arguments.content:
Section 553.3(a): Effective January 1, 2025, the regular rate of overtime pay threshold shall be $950 per week.
Section 553.3(b): Employers shall not require employees to work more than 40 hours per week without compensating overtime at one and one‑half times the regular rate.

arguments.title: FLSA Overtime Threshold Update – Action Required
arguments.body:
## Summary
- **Effective Date:** January 1, 2025
- **Change:** Weekly overtime eligibility threshold increased from **$800** to **$950**.
- **Impact:** More hourly employees will qualify for overtime pay.

## Recommendations
1. Update the payroll system configuration to use the $950 threshold.
2. Revise the internal overtime policy document (Control OVR‑001).
3. Communicate the change to all managers before the effective date.

*Source: U.S. Department of Labor Final Rule (2024‑10‑01).*

arguments.content: Section 553.3(a): Threshold $950 per week. Section 553.3(b): Overtime pay at 1.5× rate for >40 hrs/week.

messages.content: Alert sent via Slack to #payroll-compliance and to payroll-team@company.com.

### Latest FLSA Overtime Change Summary
- **Effective Date:** January 1 2025
- **Key Change:** Weekly overtime eligibility threshold raised from **$800** to **$950**.
- **Impact on Your Company:** The current payroll configuration and policy (Control OVR‑001) reference the $800 threshold, so they will be out‑of‑compliance once the rule takes effect. The overtime calculation method (Control OVR‑002) remains unchanged.

### Recommended Actions for the Payroll Team
1. **Update Payroll System:** Change the overtime eligibility threshold setting to $950.
2. **Revise Policy Document:** Amend the internal overtime policy to reflect the new $950 threshold and redistribute the updated policy.
3. **Communicate Internally:** Notify managers and HR about the expanded overtime coverage before the effective date.
4. **Validate Compliance:** Run a post‑implementation audit by March 2025 to ensure all eligible employees are correctly classified.

The alert has been posted to your Slack #payroll‑compliance channel and an email has been sent to payroll‑team@company.com. The regulatory update has been stored in the compliance database (record ID: 2024‑10‑01‑FLSA‑OT) for audit tracking.

Let me know if you need help updating the payroll configuration or drafting the policy amendment.
